title: The Ultimate Guide to Chic One-Piece Swimsuits
excerpt: Are you searching for new modest swimwear? We rounded up the best one-piece swimsuits for women at every price point. Get ready to shop.
text: Boden French Navy SnaffleFor shoppers seeking more modest swimwear options that are still stylish, Bode is the one-stop shop. The brand offers a range of suits that feature full coverage silhouettes and fun design details, all available at an accessible price point. Sizes: 2-22Colors: Navy, Green, Navy/Ivory Stripes, Baroque Tile, PaisleyMaterial: Polyamide, ElastaneCustomer review: “I wanted a longer-length swimsuit, not a halter neckline, as I find that pulls on my neck. I wanted one for swimming regularly. Most swimsuits are too low-cut or too high-cut, so you must adjust everything. This one looks gorgeous and fits the bill.”Hunza G Domino Seersucker One-Piece SwimsuitNo swimwear brand is creating the picturesque pieces you’d imagine a ’90s Hollywood starlet wearing quite like Hunza G. The London-based label has become a fashion crowd favorite for its retro-inspired high-cut swim silhouettes, signature crinkle-stretch fabric, and staunchly minimalist aesthetic. Sizes: One SizeColors: 6 optionsMaterial: Nylon, Lycra ElastaneCustomer review: “I’m a big fan of Hunza G’s swimwear, it lives up to the hype. This one-piece is super flattering and feels great on.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowJ.Crew Kay One-piece In Classic SculptYou don’t need to shop from a small label to find a good one-piece suit—and don’t sleep on J.Crew’s swim selection. With options including this ultra-sleek asymmetrical-cut sculpting one-piece, it’s a great place to find your next suit. Sizes: 0-24Colors: Sage, Black, Coral Material: Recycled polyamide, recycled polyesterCustomer review: “Wow! It holds me in and is so comfortable. It's incredibly flattering. I purchased it in black and green.” Onia Soleil One PieceWhile Onia may have built its following because of its elegant basics, the brand’s swimwear deserves just as much buzz, if not more. With a wide selection of one-piece suits featuring clean-cut silhouettes and contemporary details (e.g., keyhole cutouts, contrast piping, or distinct bows), you will surely find a suit that will become a staple in your wardrobe here. Sizes: XS-XLColors: Black, EgretMaterial: Nylon, SpandexCustomer review: “This is a suit I can wear to the public pool without raising an eyebrow, yet catch all the eyes. I love, love, love this one-piece suit.” Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowH&M Padded-Cup Bandeau SwimsuitContrary to popular belief, you don’t have to spend a ton of cash to find a chic swimsuit—you just need to spend some time scrolling through H&M’s new arrivals section. If you’re strapped for time, this strapless dusty blue one-piece adorned with gold hardware is a good place to start. No one will believe you didn’t spend a fortune on this suit—it’s that good. Sizes: XS-XL Colors: Blue, BlackMaterial: Polyamide, Spandex SAME Spiral Cutout Halterneck SwimsuitAre you searching for a one-piece swimsuit worthy of your Instagram feed? Look no further than SAME. Known for its highly photogenic pieces, the label offers everything from floral-adorned bikini sets to cutout one-pieces with chunky hardware, making it the perfect destination for an eye-catching summer suit.Sizes: XS-LColors: Black, Cream, Rust, Tropical PrintMaterial: Polyester, SpandexFounder review: “One of the most common mistakes people make when shopping for swimwear is assuming that a specific trend only exists in one shape, but that’s not the case. You should never have to choose between style and comfort, so don’t be afraid to shop around. Personally, I love our spiral cutout suit.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowLeft On Friday One-Piece SwimsuitWhat happens when two former athletes set out to create their own active apparel label? Well, that’s the origin story of Laura Low Ah Kee and Shannon Savage, who founded Left on Friday. Melding their expertise as outdoor enthusiasts with their careers at Lululemon, the founders created a line of swimwear that’s both functional and fashionable.Sizes: S-XLColors: Red, TaupeMaterial: Nylon, Polyester, LycraCustomer review: “I’m really happy with the fit of this one-piece suit. The double-layered fabric makes me feel held in, the color is adorable, and the booty fits great. I’m thrilled to have this for my next vacation.”Aerie The Surfer One Piece SwimsuitAnother place you can find surprisingly good swimsuits? Aerie. Not only do they offer budget-friendly options, but most of the brand’s one-piece suits are designed with full coverage, allowing you to feel (and look) your best all summer long. Sizes: XXS-2XL Colors: Chocolate Brown, Black, Navy StripeMaterial: Recycled Nylon, SpandexCustomer review: “I was in the market for a swimsuit for the summer and decided to browse Aerie. This item immediately caught my eye, being my favorite color with a simple but beautiful design. It's such a great swimsuit, and it looks really good.”ViX Paula Hermanny Firenze Kori Cutout One-Piece Swimsuit Every summer capsule wardrobe needs at least one statement-piece swimsuit—thankfully, the Latin American-founded label ViX Paula Hermanny has plenty of options up to the task. One of the most notable suits from the brand is this highly rated Firenze Kori one-piece suit, which features an adjustable halter neckline, prominent hardware, and a chic crepe texture. Sizes: XS-XLColors: White, Black, GreenMaterial: Polyamide, elastane Customer review: “It’s absolute perfection. I cannot even believe how perfectly this one-piece suit fits and the incredible quality!”Tory Burch Clip Tank SwimsuitIf you’re looking to invest in a designer option for the season, consider Tory Burch’s swimwear. Although the brand might be better known for its accessories and apparel, you can find its signature cool-girl aesthetic in its swimwear, too (see this swimsuit as proof).Sizes: XS-XLColors: Black, PurpleMaterial: Recycled Nylon, Lycra ElastaneCustomer review: “Such a beautiful, high-quality fabric with a nice snug fit. Buckles are so fun, too!”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowÉtam One-Piece Swimsuit With Plunge NecklineWhen you're dreaming about a trip to beaches in the South of France, the last thing you want to worry about is where to shop for a one-piece swimsuit—enter Étam into the chat. While the French label is known primarily for its lingerie, its swimwear is equally noteworthy, featuring clean-cut shapes made from sustainable materials.Sizes: XS-LColors: Black Material: Polyester, Elastane Gucci Sparkling Jersey Swimsuit With PrintFrankly, there's no better way to stand out from the sea of beachgoers this summer than with this sparkling one-piece suit from Gucci. With an ultra-flattering halter neckline, a high-leg cut, and a prominent logo, this swimsuit will grab everyone’s attention (in the best way).Sizes: XXS-LColors: BlackMaterial: Polyamide, Elastane Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMatteau Nineties MaillotAnyone who identifies as a devout minimalist can deeply resonate with the idea that clothing should last a lifetime, not a single season—that principle drives Matteau’s design approach. Since its inception in 2015, the Australian label has become known for creating sustainable resortwear through regenerative materials, timeless silhouettes, and measured seasonal drops.Sizes: XS-XLColors: Chalk, Black, BlueMaterial: Recycled nylon, recycled elastane Ramy Brook Miranda One-Piece SwimsuitAny New Yorker can attest that certain items are pivotal in everyone's closets—at least, that’s the sentiment held by fashion designer Ramy Brook, who started her namesake label in 2010. Over the years, Brook has built a fan base because of her ability to infuse a sense of sensuality into the most “simple” staples, swimwear included. With design details like plunging necklines and unique cutout details, you’re sure to find a suit that will be alluring for many years. Sizes: XS-XLColors: BlackMaterial: Nylon, Spandex Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMango V-Neck Swimsuit With Contrasting TrimIt’s typical at this point that most fashion people turn to one particular place when looking for budget-friendly and trend-conscious items—ahem, Mango. The Spanish retailer has a wide selection of warm-weather staples worth buying, but skipping the swimwear section is a big mistake. From one-pieces adorned with floral embellishments to options in shades of pastel pink, you can find so many stylish swimsuits here. Sizes: XS-LColors: Pastel PinkMaterial: Polyester, Elastane Ulla Johnson Capri One PieceThe best thing about summer? The prospect of far-off destinations. While catching flights isn’t always possible, slipping into an Ulla Johnson piece is the next best thing. Drawing inspiration from global destinations, the luxury label’s resort collections evoke wanderlust through voluminous appliqués and vibrant prints. Not only can you find a wide selection of affordable one-piece swimsuits for women, but you can also often find options that tap into some of the season’s biggest trends (such as the leopard print here). Sizes: XS-XLColors: Leopard Material: Polyester, Elastane Adriana Degreas Embellished Bandeau SwimsuitWho hasn't fantasized about a sunny day by the sea in Brazil? For some, this destination is merely a daydream, but for native designer Adriana Degreas, it’s a reality. Drawing from her roots, each collection reimagines retro swim silhouettes with contemporary twists. From strapless one-pieces adorned with beaded belts to shell-embellished bikinis, the brand’s swimwear delivers a slice of São Paulo (sans flight).Sizes: S-LColors: Brown, White Material: Polyamide, Elastane Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMaygel Coronel Agapi Floral-Appliquéd Halter One-Piece SwimsuitOne could surmise that something must be in the water below the equator, as some of the best swimwear brands in the world are headquartered in the Global South, including Maygel Coronel. Based in Colombia, the brand has cultivated a cult following across the globe for embodying the ethos of sun-drenched destinations through form-fitting beach dresses and delicately embellished swimwear.Sizes: One SizeColors: Yellow, Black, RedMaterial: Polyamide, ElastaneSir Palm Stripe One-Piece SwimsuitAnother part of the world producing some of the best one-piece swimsuits on the market? Australia—hands down. There’s no shortage of Aussie brands offering great swimwear, but one resort label reigns supreme in the eyes of the style set: Sir. With a focus on minimalist essentials through a contemporary lens, it’s no wonder it’s become the one-stop shop for unique one-piece swimsuits, sophisticated summer dresses, and so much more. Sizes: XXS-2XLColors: Palm StripeMaterial: Nylon, polyamide, Spandex
html:
Boden French Navy Snaffle

For shoppers seeking more modest swimwear options that are still stylish, Bode is the one-stop shop. The brand offers a range of suits that feature full coverage silhouettes and fun design details, all available at an accessible price point.

Sizes: 2-22

Colors: Navy, Green, Navy/Ivory Stripes, Baroque Tile, Paisley

Material: Polyamide, Elastane

Customer review: “I wanted a longer-length swimsuit, not a halter neckline, as I find that pulls on my neck. I wanted one for swimming regularly. Most swimsuits are too low-cut or too high-cut, so you must adjust everything. This one looks gorgeous and fits the bill.”

Hunza G Domino Seersucker One-Piece Swimsuit

No swimwear brand is creating the picturesque pieces you’d imagine a ’90s Hollywood starlet wearing quite like Hunza G. The London-based label has become a fashion crowd favorite for its retro-inspired high-cut swim silhouettes, signature crinkle-stretch fabric, and staunchly minimalist aesthetic.

Sizes: One Size

Colors: 6 options

Material: Nylon, Lycra Elastane

Customer review: “I’m a big fan of Hunza G’s swimwear, it lives up to the hype. This one-piece is super flattering and feels great on.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

J.Crew Kay One-piece In Classic Sculpt

You don’t need to shop from a small label to find a good one-piece suit—and don’t sleep on J.Crew’s swim selection. With options including this ultra-sleek asymmetrical-cut sculpting one-piece, it’s a great place to find your next suit.

Sizes: 0-24

Colors: Sage, Black, Coral

Material: Recycled polyamide, recycled polyester

Customer review: “Wow! It holds me in and is so comfortable. It's incredibly flattering. I purchased it in black and green.”

Onia Soleil One Piece

While Onia may have built its following because of its elegant basics, the brand’s swimwear deserves just as much buzz, if not more. With a wide selection of one-piece suits featuring clean-cut silhouettes and contemporary details (e.g., keyhole cutouts, contrast piping, or distinct bows), you will surely find a suit that will become a staple in your wardrobe here.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black, Egret

Material: Nylon, Spandex

Customer review: “This is a suit I can wear to the public pool without raising an eyebrow, yet catch all the eyes. I love, love, love this one-piece suit.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

H&M Padded-Cup Bandeau Swimsuit

Contrary to popular belief, you don’t have to spend a ton of cash to find a chic swimsuit—you just need to spend some time scrolling through H&M’s new arrivals section. If you’re strapped for time, this strapless dusty blue one-piece adorned with gold hardware is a good place to start. No one will believe you didn’t spend a fortune on this suit—it’s that good.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Blue, Black

Material: Polyamide, Spandex

SAME Spiral Cutout Halterneck Swimsuit

Are you searching for a one-piece swimsuit worthy of your Instagram feed? Look no further than SAME. Known for its highly photogenic pieces, the label offers everything from floral-adorned bikini sets to cutout one-pieces with chunky hardware, making it the perfect destination for an eye-catching summer suit.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Black, Cream, Rust, Tropical Print

Material: Polyester, Spandex

Founder review: “One of the most common mistakes people make when shopping for swimwear is assuming that a specific trend only exists in one shape, but that’s not the case. You should never have to choose between style and comfort, so don’t be afraid to shop around. Personally, I love our spiral cutout suit.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Left On Friday One-Piece Swimsuit

What happens when two former athletes set out to create their own active apparel label? Well, that’s the origin story of Laura Low Ah Kee and Shannon Savage, who founded Left on Friday. Melding their expertise as outdoor enthusiasts with their careers at Lululemon, the founders created a line of swimwear that’s both functional and fashionable.

Sizes: S-XL

Colors: Red, Taupe

Material: Nylon, Polyester, Lycra

Customer review: “I’m really happy with the fit of this one-piece suit. The double-layered fabric makes me feel held in, the color is adorable, and the booty fits great. I’m thrilled to have this for my next vacation.”

Aerie The Surfer One Piece Swimsuit

Another place you can find surprisingly good swimsuits? Aerie. Not only do they offer budget-friendly options, but most of the brand’s one-piece suits are designed with full coverage, allowing you to feel (and look) your best all summer long.

Sizes: XXS-2XL

Colors: Chocolate Brown, Black, Navy Stripe

Material: Recycled Nylon, Spandex

Customer review: “I was in the market for a swimsuit for the summer and decided to browse Aerie. This item immediately caught my eye, being my favorite color with a simple but beautiful design. It's such a great swimsuit, and it looks really good.”

ViX Paula Hermanny Firenze Kori Cutout One-Piece Swimsuit

Every summer capsule wardrobe needs at least one statement-piece swimsuit—thankfully, the Latin American-founded label ViX Paula Hermanny has plenty of options up to the task. One of the most notable suits from the brand is this highly rated Firenze Kori one-piece suit, which features an adjustable halter neckline, prominent hardware, and a chic crepe texture.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: White, Black, Green

Material: Polyamide, elastane

Customer review: “It’s absolute perfection. I cannot even believe how perfectly this one-piece suit fits and the incredible quality!”

Tory Burch Clip Tank Swimsuit

If you’re looking to invest in a designer option for the season, consider Tory Burch’s swimwear. Although the brand might be better known for its accessories and apparel, you can find its signature cool-girl aesthetic in its swimwear, too (see this swimsuit as proof).

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black, Purple

Material: Recycled Nylon, Lycra Elastane

Customer review: “Such a beautiful, high-quality fabric with a nice snug fit. Buckles are so fun, too!”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Étam One-Piece Swimsuit With Plunge Neckline

When you're dreaming about a trip to beaches in the South of France, the last thing you want to worry about is where to shop for a one-piece swimsuit—enter Étam into the chat. While the French label is known primarily for its lingerie, its swimwear is equally noteworthy, featuring clean-cut shapes made from sustainable materials.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Black

Material: Polyester, Elastane

Gucci Sparkling Jersey Swimsuit With Print

Frankly, there's no better way to stand out from the sea of beachgoers this summer than with this sparkling one-piece suit from Gucci. With an ultra-flattering halter neckline, a high-leg cut, and a prominent logo, this swimsuit will grab everyone’s attention (in the best way).

Sizes: XXS-L

Colors: Black

Material: Polyamide, Elastane

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Matteau Nineties Maillot

Anyone who identifies as a devout minimalist can deeply resonate with the idea that clothing should last a lifetime, not a single season—that principle drives Matteau’s design approach. Since its inception in 2015, the Australian label has become known for creating sustainable resortwear through regenerative materials, timeless silhouettes, and measured seasonal drops.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Chalk, Black, Blue

Material: Recycled nylon, recycled elastane

Ramy Brook Miranda One-Piece Swimsuit

Any New Yorker can attest that certain items are pivotal in everyone's closets—at least, that’s the sentiment held by fashion designer Ramy Brook, who started her namesake label in 2010. Over the years, Brook has built a fan base because of her ability to infuse a sense of sensuality into the most “simple” staples, swimwear included. With design details like plunging necklines and unique cutout details, you’re sure to find a suit that will be alluring for many years.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black

Material: Nylon, Spandex

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Mango V-Neck Swimsuit With Contrasting Trim

It’s typical at this point that most fashion people turn to one particular place when looking for budget-friendly and trend-conscious items—ahem, Mango. The Spanish retailer has a wide selection of warm-weather staples worth buying, but skipping the swimwear section is a big mistake. From one-pieces adorned with floral embellishments to options in shades of pastel pink, you can find so many stylish swimsuits here.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Pastel Pink

Material: Polyester, Elastane

Ulla Johnson Capri One Piece

The best thing about summer? The prospect of far-off destinations. While catching flights isn’t always possible, slipping into an Ulla Johnson piece is the next best thing. Drawing inspiration from global destinations, the luxury label’s resort collections evoke wanderlust through voluminous appliqués and vibrant prints. Even if you’re lounging by local waters, you’ll feel worldly in one of its one-piece suits.

Sizes: 0-16

Colors: Cowrie, Black, Coral

Material: Polyamide, elastane

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Zara Animal Print Halter Swimsuit

One of the most frustrating things about shopping for swimwear is the super-steep price points—thankfully, Zara comes in to save the day. Not only can you find a wide selection of affordable one-piece swimsuits for women, but you can also often find options that tap into some of the season’s biggest trends (such as the leopard print here).

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Leopard

Material: Polyester, Elastane

Adriana Degreas Embellished Bandeau Swimsuit

Who hasn't fantasized about a sunny day by the sea in Brazil? For some, this destination is merely a daydream, but for native designer Adriana Degreas, it’s a reality. Drawing from her roots, each collection reimagines retro swim silhouettes with contemporary twists. From strapless one-pieces adorned with beaded belts to shell-embellished bikinis, the brand’s swimwear delivers a slice of São Paulo (sans flight).

Sizes: S-L

Colors: Brown, White

Material: Polyamide, Elastane

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Maygel Coronel Agapi Floral-Appliquéd Halter One-Piece Swimsuit

One could surmise that something must be in the water below the equator, as some of the best swimwear brands in the world are headquartered in the Global South, including Maygel Coronel. Based in Colombia, the brand has cultivated a cult following across the globe for embodying the ethos of sun-drenched destinations through form-fitting beach dresses and delicately embellished swimwear.

Sizes: One Size

Colors: Yellow, Black, Red

Material: Polyamide, Elastane

Sir Palm Stripe One-Piece Swimsuit

Another part of the world producing some of the best one-piece swimsuits on the market? Australia—hands down. There’s no shortage of Aussie brands offering great swimwear, but one resort label reigns supreme in the eyes of the style set: Sir. With a focus on minimalist essentials through a contemporary lens, it’s no wonder it’s become the one-stop shop for unique one-piece swimsuits, sophisticated summer dresses, and so much more.

Sizes: XXS-2XL

Colors: Palm Stripe

Material: Nylon, polyamide, Spandex
